entries.title: Germany won't stop Poland from sending tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Despite giving Poland the green light, Mr. Scholz in an interview on Sunday did not respond when asked about sending its own Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: For Ben Shelton, avoiding international travel was part of his career development
entries.description: At 20 years old, the American, who was ranked 569th in the world a year ago, will play in the round of 16 at the Australian Open on Monday, on his first trip ever outside of the US.

entries.title: Macron wants Burkina Faso 'clarifications' on reports of call for French withdrawal
entries.description: Burkinabe media have reported that the government was giving France one month to pull out its troops stationed in the country, but no official communication has been made.

entries.title: For young French LGBTQ+ people, Montreal offers 'a haven of peace'
entries.description: Since 2013 and the protests against marriage for all in France, many young people are finding refuge in this Canadian city where they can openly live out their sexual and gender identities.

entries.title: 'The promise of easier access to parenthood for lesbian and gay couples in Quebec is a pull factor'
entries.description: Mona Greenbaum, executive director of the Quebec Coalition of LGBTQ+ Families, explains the French interest in her region.

entries.title: Handball World Championship: Barcelona trio boosts France
entries.description: In Dika Mem, Melvin Richardson and Ludovic Fabregas, the French handball team can count on a trio that is flourishing at club level with FC Barcelona, where they won the last Champions League.

entries.title: Senior Ukrainian official sacked amid corruption scandal
entries.description: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmygal announced the dismissal of Vasyl Lozynkiy, Deputy Minister of Development of Communities and Infrastructure, on suspicion of embezzlement.

entries.title: Man has testicle amputated after policeman's blow during French pension protest
entries.description: Footage showed the man receive a truncheon blow from a policeman, during protests in Paris against the government's pension reform.

entries.title: Iran: Women political prisoners demand end to protester executions and unjust sentences
entries.description: Thirty women political prisoners in Iran, including a Franco-Iranian academic and the daughter of a former president, signed a petition to defend people's 'right to live in justice.'

entries.title: TikTok's algorithm rewrites cultural practices
entries.description: Today's culture hitmaker is no longer a publisher, label, journalist or even influencer – it is an algorithm, used by everyone, mastered by none.

entries.title: India blocks 'hostile' BBC documentary about Narendra Modi on social media
entries.description: The British broadcaster's program alleges that Modi, premier of Gujarat state at the time, ordered police to turn a blind eye to deadly sectarian riots there in 2002.

entries.title: TikTok accused of spying on the US and corrupting youth
entries.description: In a mix of paranoia and puritanism, the Chinese app is facing a cabal from US officials.

entries.title: Monte Carlo Rally: Sébastien Ogier clinches record ninth victory
entries.description: The eight-time world champion opened the new season with a win on one of the most famous race circuits.

entries.title: Macron and Scholz mend strained France-Germany friendship
entries.description: Olaf Scholz called on France and Germany to be Europe's 'driving force' while Emmanuel Macron said the two countries could be the continent's 'pioneers'.

entries.title: Israel: Netanyahu removes convicted minister after Supreme Court ruling
entries.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fired Interior and Health Minister Aryeh Deri after the Supreme Court he was inelligble due to a recent tax evasion conviction.

entries.title: ChatGPT: 'The risk of mass manipulation will intensify the PR battle between Big Tech companies'
entries.description: The chatbot will do more than simply disrupt the internet economy by threatening the advertising model of the digital giants, writes economist Vincent Lorphelin.

entries.title: Swedish PM condemns Koran burning by far-right politician as 'deeply disrespectful'
entries.description: Rasmus Paludan set fire to a copy of the Muslim holy book on Saturday, January 21 in front of Turkey's embassy in Stockholm, an act which has raised tensions with Ankara.

entries.title: French pension reform: Energy sector is at forefront of protests
entries.description: After the unpopular strikes in the fall of 2022, the electricity, gas and oil unions want to rally users to their cause this time.

entries.title: Nine people killed in shooting near LA after Lunar New Year celebration
entries.description: The LA County Sheriff’s Department said the shooting took place late Saturday, January 21 at a business in Monterey Park, a city of about 60,000 with a large Asian population.

entries.title: Lebanese and European judges begin cooperation on central banker Salameh case
entries.description: Judges from France, Germany and Luxembourg visited Beirut as part of the investigation into assets belonging to the governor of the Lebanese central bank.

entries.title: Reauthorizing 'bee-killing' neonicotinoids: France's strategy ruled illegal
entries.description: As the Agriculture Ministry is preparing to extend an exemption that allows beet growers to use the banned insecticides, the practice was ruled illegal by the Court of Justice of the European Union.

entries.title: China reports nearly 13,000 Covid-related deaths in a week
entries.description: But a top health official said the country would not experience a second wave of infections because nearly 80% of the population had already been infected.

entries.title: David Crosby, a life burned at both ends
entries.description: The American singer, famous for his association with Stephen Stills, Graham Nash and Neil Young, died at 81 years after a 'long illness'.

entries.title: Parentology: In praise of the art of scribbling
entries.description: Are ordinary scribbles the path to some of the greatest contemporary painters? Nicolas Santolaria sees it as a joyfully free style of expression, which sadly children are being pushed to abandon in favor of more academic drawing.

entries.title: French-German friendship: An anniversary overshadowed by the war in Ukraine
entries.description: Emmanuel Macron and Olaf Scholz are celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Elysée Treaty this Sunday. But the conflict triggered by Russia has exacerbated the differences and misunderstandings between Paris and Berlin.

entries.title: Twitter owner Elon Musk announces more expensive ad-free subscription
entries.description: 'Ads are too frequent and too big', said Musk. He announced a subscription more expensive than Twitter Blue would be launched.

entries.title: 'I don't understand why Russia was allowed to participate in the Miss Universe contest': The diary of two sisters separated by the war in Ukraine
entries.description: This week Olga was very worried about the bombings in Ukraine. Sasha, who was feverish, was getting ready to celebrate Malenka, the Julian New Year, and was upset by the murderous attack in Dnipro. For the 47th week, the two Ukrainian sisters tell their daily lives to Le Monde's 'M' magazine.

entries.title: In South Sudan, locals take pride in working in the country's first leather products factory
entries.description: In Juba, the country's capital, Mayo Leather has been producing leather goods, from shoes to accessories, since May 2022.

entries.title: The far-right identitarians going green
entries.description: They are as alarmed by the collapse of biodiversity as they are by immigration. Breaking with their side's climate-skeptic positions, far-right activists are disputing the left's monopoly on the environment.

entries.title: What is there to do in Paris with children? Five science activities for all ages
entries.description: Travel back to the time of the dinosaurs, discover humanoid robotics, or learn about astronomy. Here are some ideas for visits in and around Paris for science enthusiasts 4 to 18 years old.

entries.title: Disenchanment at Disney amidst governance crisis
entries.description: Nelson Peltz's activist fund, Trian, has acquired $900 million worth of shares in the entertainment group and is demanding a seat on the board.

entries.title: Pakistan looks to rival India to save its economy
entries.description: The new prime minister, Shehbaz Sharif, who is struggling domestically, has proposed resuming peace talks suspended in 2019.

entries.title: 'Without Franco-German consensus, any European solution remains illusory.'
entries.description: German politician Norbert Lammert urges Emmanuel Macron and Olaf Scholz to take advantage of the 60th anniversary of the Elysée Treaty on January 22 to overcome current disagreements between the two countries.

entries.title: In Peru, half the population lacks food security
entries.description: Hunger is once again a problem due to systemic economic inequalities, which is one of the causes of the protests that have erupted since president, Pedro Castillo, was impeached.

entries.title: Australian Open: Elena Rybakina defeats number one ranked Iga Swiatek
entries.description: Rybakina, the 2022 Wimbledon winner from Kazakhstan, beat Swiatek, the French and US Open champion, to advance to the quarter-finals.

entries.title: Brazil: Lula declares public health emergency for Yanomami people in the Amazon
entries.description: The Yanomami people, who live in the largest indigenous area in Brazil, are suffering from malnutrition and diseases such as malaria as a consequence of illegal mining.

entries.title: Six additional classified documents seized at Biden's home
entries.description: Investigators conducted a nearly 13 hour search of the US President's home in Wilmington, Delaware on Friday, January 20.
